body_html:
So, sorry to be dense, but does that mean that current code will issue a warning when tf.reduce_sum(.., keep_dims=True) will issue a warning but and behave like tf.reduce_sum(..., keepdims=False) (the default)?

Don't we want to keep both and override keep_dims with keepdims if both are specified?
body_text:
So, sorry to be dense, but does that mean that current code will issue a warning when tf.reduce_sum(.., keep_dims=True) will issue a warning but and behave like tf.reduce_sum(..., keepdims=False) (the default)?
Don't we want to keep both and override keep_dims with keepdims if both are specified?
body:
So, sorry to be dense, but does that mean that current code will issue a warning when `tf.reduce_sum(.., keep_dims=True)` will issue a warning but and behave like `tf.reduce_sum(..., keepdims=False)` (the default)?

Don't we want to keep **both** and override `keep_dims` with `keepdims` if both are specified?
